required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Feasibility Study on the Model School Pediatric Health Initiative Pilot Project
clinical_study.official_title: Feasibility Study on the Model School Pediatric Health Initiative Pilot Project

brief_summary.textblock: This is a prospective cross sectional study to assess the feasibility of a school based health centre (SBHC) at Sprucecourt Public School, an inner-city elementary school in Toronto. The SBHC allows inner-city children who face barriers to accessing health care the opportunity to receive health care in their school.The primary aim of this study is to determine utilization of the SBHC. Establishing feasibility of the SBHC would support further development and expansion of this program into other inner city schools.

detailed_description.textblock: A chart review of the first year of the SBHC was conducted. Feasibility metrics included the number of children who enrolled at the SBHC. Efficacy metrics included the proportion of enrolled children who enrolled at SBHC. Efficacy metrics included the proportion of enrolled children who attended and received new diagnoses and treatment plans

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Enrolled Participants Who Attended SBHC
primary_outcome.description: The primary objectives are to determine utilization of the SBHC including: The number of students who are enrolled at the SBHC The number of enrolled students enrolled who attended the SBHC

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Students Attending SBHC With New Treatment Plans
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of children seen in the clinic with treatment plans

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Students Attending SBHC With New Diagnoses
secondary_outcome.description: Number of students attending SBHC with new diagnoses

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Referrals Made of Students Attending SBHC
secondary_outcome.description: Number of referrals of the 127 students who attended the SBHC from 8 months-1 year of the opening of the clinic

other_outcome.measure: Number of Students Enrolled in SBHC Who Were From the Host School (Sprucecourt)
other_outcome.description: The number of students who enrolled in SBHC who were from the host school Sprucecourt

other_outcome.measure: Sprucecourt Public School Vs Other Participating Schools
other_outcome.description: To compare the number of students who attend the SBHC from the host school (Sprucecourt Public School) with the number of students who attend the SBHC from the other participating schools

other_outcome.measure: Number of Students Triaged From School Support Team Meetings
other_outcome.description: The number of students triaged from SST meetings was not collected.

other_outcome.measure: Number of Students Referred to SBHC Who Attended SBHC

other_outcome.description: Attendance at follow-up appoints was not collected.
Outcome data comparing absenteeism in the school with the year preceding the SBHC was not collected
OHIP status of students attending the clinic was not reported or collected

arm_group.description: Students who attend the SBHC from either Sprucecourt Public School or any other participating schools.

intervention.description: School based health clinic. This is a cohort study as such there is only one group of children who used the SBHC

study_pop.textblock: All students of Sprucecourt Public School as well as the fourteen surrounding inner city public schools and their siblings. All children attending the on-site Parenting and Family Literacy Centre.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All students at Sprucecourt Public School and the surrounding fourteen schools, as well as their siblings (ages 0-12 years), who are enrolled at and have consent to attend the SBHC
- All infants and preschool aged children attending the on-site Parenting and Family Literacy Centre who are enrolled at the SBHC
Exclusion Criteria:

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
